techmeme.title: The cybersecurity industry is mostly quiet after Trump canceled SentinelOne's security clearances for hiring Chris Krebs; SentinelOne says it will cooperate (Reuters)
Some Meta insiders fear FAIR is "dying a slow death" as Joelle Pineau exits; Yann LeCun says it's "a new beginning" focused on "Advanced Machine Intelligence" (Sharon Goldman/Fortune)
The Nasdaq falls 4%, with Meta closing down 7%, Nvidia down 6%, Amazon down 5%, and Apple down 4% as the White House say Trump's tariffs on China now total 145% (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
UK home secretary criticizes Steam for hosting No Mercy, a game with sexual violence, rape, and incest; Steam removed the game in the UK, Australia, and Canada (Vikki Blake/GamesIndustry.biz)
BeReal rolls out in-feed ads in the US, says it has an estimated 40M MAUs, including 5M in the US, and 85% of its users are Gen Z (Amanda Silberling/TechCrunch)
